deliverables.text: Start collaboration with Cell Enginering (CE) and Therapeutics Discovery (TD) to start knowledge transfer and align on methods used  for early development
Review available data from Therapeutics Discovery (TD) on the program
Identify the needs of critical reagents of new process impurities and plan for manufacturing.
Identify new de novo methods to support new modalities.
Review of plasmid construct details with TD- sequence, maps, element tables in source document
Full plasmid sequencing and legal identification/freedom to operate before sending to CMO to start MCB activities
Sourcing committee review of plasmid supplier
EHS Requirement: Determine DG classification & packaging reqs.
Risk assessment initiated using the Risk Registers.
CMC team Assignments - confirm SIs  6 months prior to NME declaration
Target Molecule Profile developed
Critical Questions exercise to be initiated (CMC Team to lead with attendees from Discovery) and documented in the Risk Register.
Recommend adding SG 0 for CMCRA - Defining the CGT Raw Material and Starting Material Sourcing Strategy (e.g. Plasmids & Vectors, Cell line, Excipients, IP/licensing considerations e.g. Japan)
Donor material - alignment to US/EU donor testing requirements  need to have discussion whether its autologous or allogenic
Knowledge transfer from the above IPSC (Discovery to BTDS).
IPSC Meetings completed  for  knowledge transfer from Discovery.

In collaboration with TD, CLD, API, DPD and EQ complete material and supplier selection on new raw materials and ensure representative raw materials are used in early development and leading into Early Look Material (ELM), non-GLP and GLP tox batches.
